title: testnet-sanity.sh: Fix up validator sanity
Fix bank coalescing
body:
once transactions are processed, they can't be coalesced since that will break assumptions that every transaction in an entry can be spent independently. 

* coalescing the batch right before process creates a 2x performance hit (banking_stage bench)
* right thing to do is #950 i think
* @garious @pgarg66 i backed out the change to coalesce transactions.  but this brings us down to 120 nodes :(

title: add missing backslash
Vote should be valid
body: The vote stage was calling `bank.process_transaction` which would inject its signature into the bank, but then forwarded the transaction to the leader (itself).  That tx would fail.

title: rework read_ledger, LedgerWriter, and LedgerWindow for recover()

enhance ledger-tool
body:
* add json, which does the thing with json, move print to Rust's {:?}
  * add --head NUM, to limit how much work gets done for print, json, verify
  * add verify-internal, which very carefully checks ledger format without
      trying first to "recover" it
  * exit with errors on mis-usage

helps with #910

title: work on ledger
body:
* add some flushing to ledger to improve recovery times, which
       can be non-trivial with our large index BufWriter
* in non-snaps builds, move multinode-demo out of the source
        tree, to ~/.solana to help cargo

fixes #910

title: Fixed punctuation
body: Привет, друзья!

title: Alphabetize Cargo.toml for ease of use
Add coding guidelines
body:
Add Rust coding guidelines and update the codebase to reflect those guidelines.

I've asked all active contributors to review these guidelines. If you don't agree, please speak up! This only works when everyone's on board!

Noteworthy changes:

* Acknowledge `keypair` and `pubkey` as words.
* Do not acknowledge `sig` as a word.
* Boot the "first letter of each word" variable naming convention, which is not widely used and does not appear to improve readability anywhere except arguably one-liner closures.

Fixes #803

title: Rename cur_hashes to num_hashes
body: The variable name `cur_hashes` is no longer being used as originally intended so switching them all to `num_hashes` to remove what's now just an inconsistency.

title: Lower UDP data size to 64k - 128 bytes
body:
rust API gives errors for packets larger than ~65500 and
wikipedia says 65507 is the max size, lowering this avoids the errors.

title: Validators now rsync the ledger smarter
body:
- Don't re-rsync parts of the ledger that are already present
- Disable compression

title: Install EarlyOOM on testnet nodes
body:
By triggering the Linux OOM killer when RAM usage is at 20% we avoid thrashing memory as the system grinds its way down to 0 free pages and often becomes unresponsive. 

Ref: https://github.com/rfjakob/earlyoom

title: Fixed counters for coalescing and broadcast index
get buffered I/O back for ledger
Switch to slice arguments and remove clippy exceptions
Counters for broadcasted blob idx and coalesced packets
Add simple OOM Killer monitoring daemon to Snap
Rearrange start hash for process_ledger and add a unit test
Adjust fullnode oom_score_adj to goad the kernel into killing it first
localnet-sanity.sh: Validate ledger once all the tests complete
Use last_id from the entries stream instead of last_id from bank
body:
bank will only register ids when has_more is not set because those are
the only ids it has advertised, so it will not register all ids,
however the entry stream will contain unbroken last_id chain, so we
need to track that to get the correct start hash.

title: wallet cli: Remove manually created help text, use clap's text instead.
ledger-tool: Add verify subcommand
body:
Old:
```bash
$ cargo run --bin solana-ledger-tool -- --ledger config/ledger
```

New:
```bash
$ cargo run --bin solana-ledger-tool -- --ledger config/ledger verify
$ cargo run --bin solana-ledger-tool -- --ledger config/ledger print
```

new_with_bind_addr: Report the address that failed to bind
body:
Old:
> thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Os { code: 98, kind: AddrInUse, message: "Address already in use" }', libcore/result.rs:945:5

New:
> thread 'main' panicked at 'Failed to bind to V4(0.0.0.0:8000): Os { code: 48, kind: AddrInUse, message: "Address already in use" }', src/crdt.rs:1269:21

Should help more quickly debug failures like https://buildkite.com/solana-labs/solana/builds/2108#f56667de-331c-4877-9a1b-334c071440b2 in the future.

title: Upgrade ring and untrusted, and enable cargo audit

labels.name: automerge
labels.description: Merge this Pull Request automatically once CI passes

body: Running `cargo audit` tells us that `untrusted 0.5.1` has a security vulnerability and recommends upgrading to `untrusted 0.6.2`. To get there, we needed to change `GenKeys` to not implement `SecureRandom` which derives from `private::Sealed` in the latest version of `ring`.
